Node.definition: = referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= causative action by which deities cause a nation to be covered with a cloud ► causing darkness; ≈ clouds and darkness are associated with difficult circumstances
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= a low stool; ► for resting the feet on when sitting; ≈ often associated with authority

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow|Jacob
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction|= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group|= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: to goes to reach (the ground); hence: = causative action by which deities cause a high building to be completely destroyed until only rubble remains; ≈ associated with total humiliation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans show total disrespect for a process that is considered holy and/or worthy of respect ◄ by words or actions that are not in line with the behavior that is associated with it
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= causative action by which part of an object is violently removed from a larger unit, with the help of a sharp object, so that it falls to the ground
= state in which someone experiences extreme displeasure
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

= outgrowth of bone encased in hardened skin, often curved and pointed, found in pairs on the heads of cattle, sheep, goats, and other animals; ≈ associated with strength and honor; a raised horn symbolizes confidence and/or pride

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to turn (one's) hand (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans keep themselves from engaging in a certain activity

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
literally: to burn; hence: = process by which events such as evil and anger happen with intensity and with consequences, as if it were fire

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= causative action by which humans bend a bow (קֶשֶׁת) by drawing its string towards them ► in order to shoot an arrow
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
literally: to pout our (one's) anger; hence: = action by which deities give full vent to their anger by punishing the offender

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace
= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= state of deep sorrow and grief; ◄ caused by the death of a relative or friend or by other tragic circumstances
= state of deep sorrow and grief; ◄ caused by the death of a relative or friend or by other tragic circumstances

Node.gloss: to drop|to let go|to give up
Node.definition: = action by which deities detach themselves from an object to which they used to feel attached
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

= a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, a metaphor for Jerusalem, the place where God dwells
= a festival that is celebrated at fixed times
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= a festival that is celebrated at fixed times
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= action by which someone makes a conscious decision to dismiss a certain object, person, or deity as inadequate, faulty, or otherwise unacceptable
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= action by which deities =turn away from an object that they used to feel affection for
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
= causative action of controling and restricting movement; that is, to hand over a person or an object to another's control
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a festival that is celebrated at fixed times
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

Node.gloss: to stretch out a measuring line
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out a measuring line (over something); hence: = action by which humans or deities determine the measurements of an area as part of a construction or demolition job
= line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards
literally: to turn (one's) hand (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans keep themselves from engaging in a certain activity
literally: to turn (one's) hand from (an event); hence: = action by which humans and deities purposefully refrain from engaing in a particular event

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others

= causative action by which deities cause or allow humans to experience grief ◄ as a result of bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances; ≈ in all cases personified to apply to inanimate objects such as parts of nature or buildings

meaning unsure; probably: = a structure surrounding a town, outside the main wall; ◄ made out of of stones or bricks; ► provides strength and security to the town; ≈ sometimes used metaphorically to denote someone who offers protection

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

= state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation
= process by which humans or objects is lowered into a space of restricted movement

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to be silent|to keep silent|to remain silent|to be silenced
Node.definition: = to refrain from speaking
= a person who is nearing the end of a relatively long life; ≈ regarded as wise, worthy of respect, and an asset to the community
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
literally: to cause to go up; hence: = causative process by which an object is caused to appear on top of or over another one
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

Node.gloss: to gird oneself|to put on (clothes, armor)
Node.definition: = action by which someone ties a belt or piece of cloth around the waist; hence also: to put on clothes or armor
= a coarse dark material ◄ made of goat or camel hair; ► worn next to the skin as a sign of mourning or repentance

Node.gloss: to lower|to let down|to take down|to bring down|to take off (ornaments)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to move from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
literally: (one's) eyes are finished; hence: = process by which someone's eyes become affected by excessive weeping or hardship
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to be agitated|to be in turmoil|to be disturbed
Node.definition: = state in which parts of one's body function in an abnormal way ◄ as if agitated or fermenting; ≈ associated with deep sorrow

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion
= causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a large lobed glandular organ in the abdomen, involved in processing digestive products, neutralizing toxins, and other metabolic processes
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= state in which humans are totally without physical strength and on the brink of death; ◄ caused by hunger and thirst and/or other physical suffering
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
= a child that is still drinking milk from its mother's breasts
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= state in which humans are totally without physical strength and on the brink of death; ◄ caused by hunger and thirst and/or other physical suffering
= state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
literally: to pour out (one's) life; hence: = process by which humans slowly stop breathing and die

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to testify|to bring a charge|to bear witness
Node.definition: = action with which a person gives evidence or proof of something, often as a witness in a legal setting ► the witness can be favorable or unfavorable

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which humans measure the similarity or dissimilarity between two entities
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= state in which an event cannot be relied on to be true and trustworthy; ◄ like an ugly and/or badly constructed wall that has been covered with whitewash
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

Node.gloss: to restore the fortunes (of a nation)
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group
= causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to give up a certain pattern of behavior and start engaging in other activities which are usually regarded as unacceptable
literally: to strike (one's) palms (together); hence: = action by which humans express their anger and disgust by striking their hands together

Node.gloss: to clap (one's) hands (out of anger, frustration, disgust)
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure, possibly: = to strike the palm of one's hand against the other hand ≈ as a symbol of anger, frustration, or disgust

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which an object has been affected by an event in its entirety
= state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to grind one's teeth|to gnash one's teeth
Node.definition: = to gnash or grind one's teeth עַל with regard to someone else ► in order to express one's hostility

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which deities or humans put together a plan or strategy to act on; often in a bad sense
= a causative process by which deities or humans bring a process to its end by completing it in its entirety
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to lift up (someone's) horn > to restore (someone's) confidence
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone else's) horn; hence: = causative action by which deities restore the inner strength of humans

= outgrowth of bone encased in hardened skin, often curved and pointed, found in pairs on the heads of cattle, sheep, goats, and other animals; ≈ associated with strength and honor; a raised horn symbolizes confidence and/or pride
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= collection of dwellings, surrounded by a wall; ◄ manmade; ► population center
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

Node.gloss: to let flow down|to let run down|to let stream down
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause bodies of water to flow from a higher elevation to a lower elevation
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= during the daytime
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to be silent|to keep silent|to remain silent|to be silenced
Node.definition: = to refrain from speaking
= a part of a larger object, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that object

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
literally: head; hence: = the point in time at which an event starts happening
= period of four hours during the night, divided as such for the sake of watchmen; ≈ associated with the notion of being unable to sleep

Node.gloss: to pour out (one's) heart|to pour out (one's) soul
Node.definition: literally: to pour out (one's) inner person (before someone else); hence: = to communicate one's thoughts and emotions to someone else
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which humans raise their arms to receive out, beckon, bless, or pray

Node.gloss: to spread out one's hands > to pray
Node.definition: literally: to spread out or lift up one's palms; hence: = to present one's prayer and supplication before God by showing him one's empty hands

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= offspring of human beings, ◄ literally depicted as the fruit of the womb, as if it were a plant; ≈ regarded as a blessing from God
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which a woman gives birth to a child

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare
= a person who is nearing the end of a relatively long life; ≈ regarded as wise, worthy of respect, and an asset to the community
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= causative action by which humans or deities kill other humans with a sharp bladed instrument; ≈ associated with anger, power, callousness (of the killer), and helplessness (of the victim)

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
literally: to call, summon; hence: = causative action by which deities cause certain things to happen, ◄ as if they were people that were summoned

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a festival that is celebrated at fixed times
= state in which humans experience a strong fear that certain things might happen to them

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a person who was able to flee from danger
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which humans bring forth a child
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= literally: to finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance
